credits:
Adapted with permission from COVID-19 Home Based Care: How to do it best for the patient and the family, 2020, Difaem - German Institute for Medical Mission, www.difaem.









This resource has been developed using reputable public health sources for educational purposes only. It is not a substitute for professional medical advice. For questions or concerns about any topic described here, please consult a health professional.
summary: • This book tells how to give home-based care while also protecting others in the household and community who are not sick. COVID-19 is a serious illness, but there are ways to help the sick person be more comfortable, and most survive the illness.

29.en: Wear a mask when in a shared space.

30.en: Wash hands frequently and don’t touch your face or mask

31.en: People who are sick with the virus may not show all the signs.

32.en: If someone has any of these signs, they should be tested, if possible. It is important to tell other people who they have been close to about their illness so those people can also watch for signs of illness. Those people should also stay away from other people for fourteen days to avoid spreading the illness.

34.en: People are most contagious when they first feel they are getting sick. Many people have very mild symptoms, but they can still spread the illness to other people, who may get very sick.

36.en: Everyone else in the household should stay away from the sick person, wash their hands often, and avoid touching their faces. They should wear masks when they are in any area where the sick person goes.

48.en: Home Care for Someone with Mild Sickness

49.en: Paracetamol, Aspirin (ASA, Acetyl Salicylic Acid) and Ibuprofen are medications that can help with fever and pain. It is important to follow the directions of a health worker to give the correct amount of medicine.

51.en: Whenever the person uses the toilet or bathroom, all surfaces should be wiped with disinfectant, especially door handles, water taps. Wash surfaces and wash cleaning cloths often.

52.en: Home Care for the Very Sick Person or People

57.en: • No visitors should come near the patient because they might get sick and spread the illness.

59.en: Keep the patient in a well-ventilated room, near a window or where they can feel air blowing on them. Fresh air will help them breathe better. They can be outside too, if they won’t be in contact with other people.

61.en: Help them change positions regularly. When they are awake, help them lie on their stomach for a while if they can. This helps their lungs work better.
